qas.question: What services do Norfolk Island residents believe should be made available from the Norfolk Island's EEZ profit?
What is Norfolk Island's only major natural resource?
What is the name of the area residents of Norfolk Island are permitted to fish recreationally?
What is speculated to be available in Norfolk Island's EEZ zone?
What percentage of Norfolk Island is a permanent pasture?
What services do Norfolk Island residents believe should be made unavailable from the Norfolk Island's EEZ profit?
What is Norfolk Island's only resource?
What is the name of the area residents of Norfolk Island are permitted to fish illegally?
What is speculated to be forbidden in Norfolk Island's EEZ zone?
What percentage of Norfolk Island is no longer a permanent pasture?

context: The Australian government controls the exclusive economic zone (EEZ) and revenue from it extending 200 nautical miles (370 km) around Norfolk Island (roughly 428,000km2) and territorial sea claims to three nautical miles (6 km) from the island. There is a strong belief on the island that some of the revenue generated from Norfolk's EEZ should be available to providing services such as <a0_0><b5_0>health and infrastructure<b5_0/><a0_0/> on the island, which the island has been responsible for, similar to how the Northern Territory is able to access revenue from their mineral resources. The exclusive economic zone provides the islanders with <a1_0><b6_0>fish<b6_0/><a1_0/>, its only major natural resource. Norfolk Island has no direct control over any marine areas but has an agreement with the Commonwealth through the Australian Fisheries Management Authority (AFMA) to fish "recreationally" in a small section of the EEZ known locally as "<a2_0><b7_0>the Box<b7_0/><a2_0/>". While there is speculation that the zone may include <a3_0><b8_0>oil and gas deposits<b8_0/><a3_0/>, this is not proven. There are no major arable lands or permanent farmlands, though about <a4_0><b9_0>25<b9_0/><a4_0/> per cent of the island is a permanent pasture. There is no irrigated land. The island uses the Australian dollar as its currency.
